ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Study stage
Notes: 0 = Pre-Randomization (TADS) 1 = Stage 1 (TADS) 2 = Stage 2 (TADS) 3 = Stage 3 (TADS) 4 = Stage 4 (TADS) 5 = Stage 5 (SOFTAD); 51=Treatmentas Usual; 52=Screening Alone; 53=Intervention; 67=Unknown; -888=Not Applicable; -999=Missing;

ElementDescription: What treatment assignment information did the family receive?
Notes: 1 = Pills only; 2 = Cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) only; 3 = Combination of CBT and Fluoxetine; 4=Placebo; 5 = Sertraline and Cognitive Behavioral Therapy; 6 = Sertraline only;7=Medication Management (MM); 8=MM + CBT

ElementDescription: What was the teen's reaction to the treatment assignment?
Notes: 1 = Extremely disappointed 2 = Disappointed 3 = Neutral 4 = Pleased 5 = Extremely pleased

ElementDescription: What was the mother's (or mother figure's) reaction to the treatment assignment?
Notes: 1 = Extremely disappointed 2 = Disappointed 3 = Neutral 4 = Pleased 5 = Extremely pleased 9 = Mother figure not present

ElementDescription: What was the father's (or father figure's) reaction to the treatment assignment?
Notes: 1 = Extremely disappointed 2 = Disappointed 3 = Neutral 4 = Pleased 5 = Extremely pleased 9 = Father figure not present

ElementDescription: Visit name
Number of days from study baseline to date of visit
What was the child's reaction to the treatment assignment?
Notes: 1 = Extremely disappointed 2 = Disappointed 3 = Neutral 4 = Pleased 5 = Extremely pleased

ElementDescription: Average Parent Reaction to Treatment Assignment
Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
Indicator noting imputed data set number
Days since baseline
Site
Timepoint/visit label
Notes: e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2; Morning, At Bedtime

ElementDescription: Rating of the child''s/family''s behavior in this session: On-task/attentiveness
Rating of the child''s/family''s behavior in this session: Participation/involvement
Rating of the child''s/family''s behavior in this session: Understanding of the material
Rating of the child''s/family''s behavior in this session: Amount of material covered/productivity
Rating of the child''s/family''s behavior in this session: Overall session progress
Family problems/issues
What was the student''s reaction to the treatment assignment?
Notes: 1 = Extremely disappointed; 2 = Disappointed; 3 = Neutral; 4 = Pleased; 5 = Extremely pleased

ElementDescription: What was your reaction to the treatment assigment?
Notes: 1 = Extremely disappointed; 2 = Disappointed; 3 = Neutral; 4 = Pleased; 5 = Extremely pleased
